page.title: 01Longnor
page.content: Longnor is a small parish on the sandstone ridge between the rivers Dove and Manifold. It is thought that the name means 'Long Ridge'. The steep face of the ridge which faces North and East is pasture with much thorn and gorse scrub. The gentler face of the ridge towards the South and the West is now covered with meadow and pasture. There is a series of long narrow fields running from the top of the ridge on this side to the River Manifold and it is thought that these field boundaries mark the site of a strip-field system of farming. On the other side of the Dove is the steep limestone slope to the rolling tops of the southern end of the White Peak. This part in notable for the lack of surface drainage and the number of dew ponds.
